alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 19 at 8:28AM EST until December 20 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Portions of East Central and North Central Maine, including the following counties, in East Central Maine, Penobscot. In North Central Maine, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 825 AM EST, extensive flooding remains over southwestern Piscataquis County from runoff due to significant rainfall. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dover-Foxcroft, Dexter, Greenville, Guilford, Monson, Blanchard, Elliottsville, Kingsbury Plantation, Frenchtown, Sangerville, Garland, Parkman, Abbot, Wellington, Shirley, Willimantic, Beaver Cove, Bowerbank, Kingsbury and Onawa. - For flood safety http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
